Name: Gin Gin Mule
Ingredients: 5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Collins glass .
Prepare garnish of lime wedge and mint sprigs.
Garnish with lime wedge and mint sprigs bouquet.
Review: Zingy ginger and gin's botanical notes make this much more than just another take on the Moscow Mule .
History: Adapted from a recipe created in 2000 by Audrey Saunders at Beacon, New York City, USA. Audreys's original (and our previous) recipe calls for muddled fresh ginger and sugar syrup (rather than ginger liqueur): - 2 slice Fresh ginger root (thumbnail-sized) - 60ml (2oz) Gin - 15ml (½oz) Lime juice - 7.5ml (¼oz) Sugar syrup - 12 fresh Mint leaves - 82.5ml (2¾oz)Top with Ginger beer
